sen.j: 芳野監（よしのげん）は、8世紀の日本で吉野地方に設けられた特別な地方行政区分、機関である。
sen.e: Yoshino Gen was a local administration division or organization established in the Yoshino Area in Japan in the eighth century.
Yoshino Gen was a special local administration division or organization established in the Yoshino area in Japan in the eighth century.
Yoshino Gen was a special local administration division or organization established in the Yoshino area in Japan in the eighth century.
It was included in the Kinai Province.
It was included in the Kinai region.
It was included in the Kinai region.

sen.j: 領域は現在の奈良県南部にあたる。
sen.e: The territory was located in the southern part of Nara Prefecture.
The territory was located in the southern part of Nara Prefecture.
The territory was located in the southern part of Nara Prefecture.
History
History
History

sen.j: 大和国の吉野郡を分立させて設けられた。
sen.e: It was established by separating the Yoshino district of Yamato Province.
It was established by separating the Yoshino no kori (Yoshino district) of Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 吉野郡→Yoshino no kori を追加しました。
sen.e: It was established by separating the Yoshino no kori (Yoshino district) of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 設置時期は不明だが、和泉国が設置された霊亀2年 (716年) に近い時期と思われる。
sen.e: The time of establishment was unknown, but it was close to 716 in which Izumi Province was established.
The time of establishment was unknown, but it is thought to have been close to 716 in which Izumi Province was established.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を追加しました。
sen.e: The time of establishment was unknown, but it is thought to have been close to 716 in which Izumi Province was established.

sen.j: 令制国でなく、司という機関になったのは、この地にあった吉野宮の管理にあたる役割があったためと推測されている。
sen.e: It is estimated that it became an organization named Tsukasa, not ryoseikoku (province), because it had a role of managing the Yoshino no miya located there.
It is estimated that it became an organization named Gen, not ryoseikoku (province), because it had a role of managing the Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) located there.
sen.cmt: 吉野宮→Yoshino palace を追加しました。原文wiki には、「司」ではなく、「監」とあり、文脈上もそのほうが分かりやすいため、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: It is estimated that it became an organization named Gen, not ryoseikoku (province), because it had a role of managing the Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) located there.

sen.j: 天平10年 (738年) 以降に廃止された。
sen.e: It was abolished in 738.
Yoshino Gen was abolished sometime after 738.
sen.cmt: in→ after に変更しました。
sen.e: Yoshino Gen was abolished sometime after 738.
